body_html:
Oh, thanx for the info @mkalininait 🙏

Ad a) (the button)
I know it stays like that - I thought it would be a "feature" actually 😂
So as the rendering takes hours, I want to prevent people pressing the button a million times, that's why I disable it after the first click. It then stays like this, since it's not an ajax request (the content type is text/csv).
But: pressing it again after that does not make any sense - the data would be exactly the same. Therefore I thought it would actually be useful to have it disabled all the time...

Ad 2)
Picks / Likes 1 and 2 are the number of picks and likes the application got from the mentors for Project 1and Project 2´. For theaverage_points` being wrong and the last column overlapping I honestly don't know right from the top of my head now. Maybe it even has to do with #725 not being merged into this branch yet (I did not have the time to do this yesterday).

And @beanieboi, feel free to go ahead with implementing the fixes if you're already on it. I won't have time until around 4pm CEST. I could then ping you again on Slack whether the things are already covered or not.

Ad 2)

For theaverage_points` being wrong and the last column overlapping I honestly don't know right from the top of my head now. body:
Oh, thanx for the info @mkalininait 🙏 

**Ad a) *(the button)***
I know it stays like that - I thought it would be a *"feature*" actually 😂 
So as the rendering takes hours, I want to prevent people pressing the button a million times, that's why I disable it after the first click. It then stays like this, since it's not an ajax request (the content type is `text/csv`).
**But**: pressing it again after that does not make any sense - the data would be exactly the same. Therefore I thought it would actually be useful to have it disabled all the time...

**Ad 2)**
Picks / Likes 1 and 2 are the number of `picks` and `likes` the application got from the mentors for `Project 1`and `Project 2´.
For the `average_points` being wrong and the last column overlapping I honestly don't know right from the top of my head now. Maybe it even has to do with #725 not being merged into this branch yet *(I did not have the time to do this yesterday)*.

And @beanieboi, feel free to go ahead with implementing the fixes if you're already on it. I won't have time until around 4pm CEST. I could then ping you again on Slack whether the things are already covered or not.
